text:
While doing a routine link check on the Ant 1.6.2 manual, I noticed that links
to CoreTypes/regexp.html were broken... and in fact the 1.6.2 distribution does
not seem to have this file. Looking at the CVS log I see that although the file
was created on 2003/12/01, it has no CVS tags, and is thus not present in the
Ant 1.6.x branch. Probably someone created the file on the trunk after
ANT_16_BRANCH had been made and then used an incorrect CVS command to merge
outstanding trunk changes to the branch? (If you use CVS commands correctly,
additions and removals will be handled transparently, but it is all too easy to
use different command styles which handle modifications correctly but not
additions and removals.) Someone should probably check to see if there are other
files missing the ANT_16_BRANCH tag which ought to have it, e.g. sanity-check
the output of

cvs -q rdiff -u -r ANT_16_BRANCH -r HEAD ant | fgrep 'diff -u /dev/null'
creator: jglick@apache.org

text:
Hello Jesse,
the link 
I had fixed bug 15390 only for ant 1.7.
Somehow the change in docs/manual/CoreTypes/filterchain.html slipped through.
I guess the only thing I can do now would be to merge the changes I did to allow
choosing the regexp implementation into the ANT_16 branch.
creator: antoine@apache.org

text: Or revert the accidental docs change in the branch.
creator: jglick@apache.org
antoine@apache.org
text: Solved by merging the changes for PR 15390 into ANT_16_BRANCH
